title: FIFA adds low cost tickets for 2026 World Cup games
snippets: Fifa introduces a small number of "more affordable" $60 (£45) tickets for all 104 matches at the 2026 World Cup following criticism of its pricing structure for the tournament.
FIFA slashed the price of some World Cup tickets for teams' most loyal fans following a global backlash.
FIFA slashed the price of some World Cup tickets for teams' most loyal fans following a global backlash and some will get $60 US seats for the final instead of being asked to pay $4,185.
FIFA has mounted a major climbdown in the ongoing row about World Cup 2026 ticket prices by announcing a small number of fans will be able to pay just £45 ($60) for each game, including the final.

MIAMI — FIFA slashed the price of some World Cup tickets for teams’ most loyal fans following a global backlash and some will get $60 seats for the final instead of being asked to pay $4,185. FIFA said Tuesday that $60 tickets will be made available for every game at the tournament in North America, going to the national federations whose teams are playing. Those federations decide how to distribute them to loyal fans who have attended previous games at home and on the road. The number of $60 tickets for each game is likely to be in the hundreds, rather than thousands, in what FIFA is now...
A certain number of $60 tickets to every World Cup match will be allotted to participating nations' national federations, FIFA announced.

Prices for the ‘supporter entry’ tier are capped at $60 Tier will be available to supporters for all 104 games Allocation will comprise 1.6% of available tickets Amid backlash against exorbitant prices for the 2026 World Cup, Fifa on Tuesday announced that it had created a new tier of tickets specif
titles: Fifa announces small number of £45 World Cup tickets after criticism of prices
Fifa introduces some £45 World Cup tickets after backlash
FIFA slashes some WC ticket prices after backlash

summary: FIFA has responded to criticism over high ticket prices for the 2026 World Cup by introducing a new $60 "supporter entry" ticket tier for all 104 matches, including the final. These tickets, making up about 1.6% of total tickets per game, will be allocated to national federations for distribution to loyal fans. The move follows global backlash against previously high prices, with some final tickets originally costing up to $4,185.

Gold prices increased slightly following the release of the data.

title: Thousands of dinosaur footprints found on Italian mountain
snippets: The footprints date back some 210 million years and show traces of toes and claws.

A wildlife photographer stumbled upon one of the oldest and largest known collections of dinosaur footprints, dating back about 210 million years to the Triassic Period, high in an Italian national park near the 2026 Milan Cortina Winter Olympic venue of Bormio, officials announced Tuesday.

title: 'Slop' chosen as Merriam-Webster's 2025 Word of the Year
snippets: Merriam-Webster has chosen "slop" as its biggest buzzword of the year. The US dictionary publisher says the word reflects a growing frustration — and fascination — with poor-quality generative AI flooding the internet.
Dictionary codifies the term that took hold in 2024 for low-quality AI-generated content.
